result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*8/15/2022  Honorable T. Christopher Dee:  Court set restitution at zero.*
Hearing August 15, 2022 at 9:30 a.m.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
All costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharge to be paid by the end of probation 6/30/2023 or to convert to a civil judgment.
Maintain work and school.  If defendant is unemployed the PO agent is to set up job training program.

No contact with any Walmart, Home Depot or Pick N Save.
No possession of any illegal drugs.
AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety with random testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Ferrer Rolon

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance previously waived.  State has had no response from the victim, Walmart.  Court set restitution at zero.

Defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2:  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 10 days time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- maintain work and school, if defendant is unemployed the PO Agent is to setup job training program
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no contact with ANY Walmart, Home Depot, or Pick n Save
-  no possession of any illegal drugs
Court further ordered:
- AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatments

Court ordered restitution hearing to be scheduled.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 06/30/2023 to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given.

 Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Elements of the Offense, received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing with 21CM1338 and 21CM1338. Attorney Domask was recently appointed and requests additional time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Walmart Supercenter
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Jonathan Ferrer Rolon in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
